org.apache.flex.compiler.common

Interface IImportTarget

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ASImportTarget

    public interface IImportTarget
    Represents the target of an import statement (e.g. import mx.controls.Button or import mx.controls.*) and encapsulates the logic involved in combining a reference (Button or mx.controls.Button) with the import target to get a fully qualified name. You can create import targets from the import target string (with the constructor), from a package name, or from an XML namespace.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      INamespaceDefinition getNamespace()

    • Method Detail

      • getQualifiedName

        String getQualifiedName(String reference)
        Interpret the reference based on this import target, and try to build a qualified class name for it. If no logical path can be constructed from the two (because the reference contains package information that doesn't match the import target, or because the reference class doesn't match the import target class), this method returns null. The one exception to this rule (for convenience) is the import target "*", which will always return the reference itself Examples (import target + reference): mx.controls.* + Button => mx.controls.Button mx.core.* + Button => mx.core.Button mx.controls.Button + Button => mx.controls.Button mx.controls.RadioButton + Button => (null) * + Button => Button mx.controls.* + mx.controls.Button => mx.controls.Button mx.core.* + mx.controls.Button => (null) mx.controls.Button + mx.controls.Button => mx.controls.Button mx.controls.RadioButton + mx.controls.Button => (null) * + mx.controls.Button => mx.controls.Button
        Parameters:
        reference - the reference as it appears in the document
        Returns:
        a qualified name for the reference if it makes sense; null if it doesn't

      • getTargetPackage

        String getTargetPackage()
        Returns the name of the target package we are targeting
        Returns:
        the target package

      • isWildcard

        boolean isWildcard()
        True if this import is a wild card
        Returns:
        true if we are a wild card

      • getTargetName

        String getTargetName()
        Gets the name of the target in our import. In flash.events.EventDispatcher, it would be EventDispatcher
        Returns:
        the target name.

      • getNamespace

        INamespaceDefinition getNamespace()
        Gets the INamespaceDefinition for the imported package's public namespace.
        Returns:
        The INamespaceDefinition for the imported package's public namespace.
